message_number: THE GRACE OF GOD AND THE ALL-INCLUSIVE SPIRIT
message_title: Message Six The Grace of God and the All-inclusive Spirit
0: I. In 2 Corinthians Christ as the grace of God is the good land for us to enter into, experience, enjoy, partake of, and pos- sess-John 1:17; 1 Cor. 15:10; cf. Gal. 2:20; 1 Cor. 5:7; 10:3-4; 2 Cor. 13:14:
1: A. In 2 Corinthians 13:14 the grace of the Lord is mentioned first because this book is on the grace of Christ-1:12; 4:15; 6:1; 8:1, 9; 9:8, 14; 12:9:
2: 1. The Holy Spirit as the circulation, the transmission, of the grace of Christ with the love of the Father is the supply in our Christian life and church life:
3: a. The entire church life depends upon 2 Corinthians 13:14.
4: b. The current of the Divine Trinity within us as revealed in 2 Corinthians 13:14 is our spiritual pulse.
5: 2. The blessing in 2 Corinthians 13:14 is the same as that in Numbers 6:22-27; this is the eternal blessing of the Triune God, which is the Triune God dispensing Himself in His Divine Trinity into us for our enjoyment:
6: a. "Jehovah bless you and keep you" is the love of God the Father as the fountain of life and light-v. 24; Psa. 36:9.
7: b. "Jehovah make His face shine upon you and be gracious to you" is the grace of Christ as the fatness of God's house- Num. 6:25; Psa. 36:8.
8: c. "Jehovah lift up His countenance upon you and give you peace" is the fellowship of the Holy Spirit as the river of God's pleasures-Num. 6:26; Psa. 36:8.
9: B. The grace of God in His economy is rich, multiplying, and abound- ing-Eph. 2:7; 1 Pet. 1:2b; 2 Pet. 1:2; Eph. 1:7b-8:
10: 1. God has graced us in the Beloved-v. 6.
11: 2. We have obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand-Rom. 5:2a.
12: 3. When Christ in us is daily received, experienced, and enjoyed by us, that is grace being added to us, grace upon grace-John 1:16.
13: C. The new covenant ministers' living is the living of grace, the ex- perience of grace-Heb. 12:28; 1 Cor. 15:10; 2 Cor. 1:12, 15:
14: 1. The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the Spirit of grace, is with our spirit, which has been regenerated to be the dwelling place and vessel of the Triune God-Heb. 10:29b; Gal. 6:18; Phil. 4:23; Philem. 25; 2 Tim. 4:22; cf. 1:6-7.
15: 2. Whenever we turn to our spirit, we enter through the gate of heaven and touch the throne of grace in heaven through Christ as the heavenly ladder-Heb. 4:16; Gen. 28:12-17; John 1:51; Eph. 2:22.
16: 3. Grace is with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in incorruptibility-6:24.
18: 4. Humility saves us from all kinds of destruction and invites God's grace-1 Pet. 5:5-6; James 4:6.
19: 5. We need to enjoy the word of His grace-Acts 20:32; Jer. 15:16.
20: 6. We need to experience the Spirit of grace and of supplications to bring us into the enjoyment of the Triune God-Zech. 12:10a.
21: 7. The new covenant ministers enjoy Christ as their all-sufficient grace through sufferings:
22: a. The ministry of the new covenant is produced by revelation plus suffering-2 Cor. 12:7; 1:3-4, 8-10.
23: b. Christ as grace becomes power tabernacling over the new covenant ministers, overshadowing them in their weak- ness to become their dwelling place to sustain, support, maintain, protect, and keep them-12:9b.
24: 8. We need the grace of God in Christ applied to us as the strength and power for our move and our protection-Ezek. 1:6b, 9a; Exo. 19:4; Isa. 40:31; 2 Cor. 4:7; 1:12; 12:9; 1 Cor. 15:10; Psa. 17:8; 57:1; 63:7; 91:4.
25: 9. We reign in life by receiving the abundance of grace-Rom. 5:17.
26: 10. We need to be good stewards of the varied grace of God-1 Pet. 4:10; Eph. 3:2. V
27: 11. Our word should convey grace to the hearers-Luke 4:22; Eph. 4:29; Isa. 50:4.
28: 12. We need to enjoy the grace of life in the church life to keep ourselves in the genuine oneness-Psa. 133.
29: 13. In the church life, when we have grace upon us, the church will be built up, and the grace that we receive will be visible-Acts 4:33; 11:23.
